events.message: Customer reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of March 31st involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident following review of the initial report and keywords related to vehicle collision.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to manage the accident claim and to ensure timely communication with the customer.
The customer was formally acknowledged about the receipt of their collision claim and provided with next steps in the process.
Request sent to the customer for vehicle repair estimates, police report, and photographs of the accident damage.
Customer provided all the requested documents, including the police report and multiple pictures of the accident scene and damage.
Internal investigation commenced to verify the details of the collision and assess the vehicle damage reported.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the customer’s vehicle sustained significant damage in the accident, and liability established.
A settlement offer was proposed covering vehicle repair costs and related expenses based on the investigation findings.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and was appreciative of the clear communication throughout the claims process.
The claim was formally approved after customer consented to the settlement offer without any objections.
Payment was issued to the customer’s designated account to cover the approved settlement amount for vehicle repairs.
The insurance claim for the auto accident was officially closed following payment and positive customer feedback.
